Mattias, playing with the art program can be fascinating.  After 
using it, I can see that there is indeed a process of 
complexification that happens to the networks.  It's really 
interesting to see how the increases in network complexity contibute 
to the richness of the image.

One thing that would be very interesting would be an interface, for 
example sliders, where you yourself could adjust the weights of the 
champion  and see the effects.  I think this would help people (me 
at least) understand what the different dimensions of variation of 
these complex images are with respect to the network.  It would be 
cool for example to discover that increasing the value of a weight 
changes the orientation or expands the size of some element.  It 
would also be fun to play with.  Most importantly, it would give you 
a sense of what kind of variation is possible, and what is not.

Another thing that might be useful is if you could actually paint a 
target image and then evolve for n generations towards that target 
with normal NEAT evolution.  Then you could play with the art 
evolution starting off the champ of that pre-evolution.  That way, 
you might get creative variations on images that you actually want.

A full-window view of a single requested image would also look great.

While the whole art/fun factor is very cool, I also feel that we can 
learn a lot about how neural networks of increasing 
complexity "think" with a tool like this.  You start getting an 
intuition about the way changes in weights maniuplate various 
components of their functionality, and how those components 
interact.  So it's really valuable educationally.

ken

PS check out the "ear" I evolved in the photos section 
   :) <-- a proud evolutionary artist
